name: Holiday Inn Stratford-upon-Avon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: £85 got us a lovely room and breakfast for two which in Stratford was a very good rate.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you don't mind paying a little extra!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff were really friendly, the room was immaculate and the breakfast was fantastic!! If you do stay here, pay in full on arrival coz checkout looked a bit mad, get down to breakfast before 9am too, coz after 9am the queue was out of the door!!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: All in all this was the most we've ever paid for a hotel but it was worth it.
reviews.title: Worth the money...questionable!

likes.disliked: — Disconnect from the lobby area to the rooms and corridors in terms of appearance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Miles ahead of most UK Holiday Inns, this former Moat House is highly recommended. Unbeatable, picturesque location in central Stratford, a short stroll to all area attractions. Very well-maintained property with many amenities. Despite comments to the contrary from other Tripadvisor reviewers, we found the hotel staff courteous, helpful and friendly. Wonderful bar area, with picturesque outdoor seating. Good value. We will return.
reviews.title: Mordern large room and hotel in excellent location

likes.liked: — Very modern, clean and great location

reviews.text: From the ground floor lobby area, interior restaurants and so on the impression of the hotel was positive. Expectations of a nice room well worth the money...a cut above the rest! At check in staff were doing "their duty" but not very friendly.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Stratford-upon-Avon

reviews.text: I booked a large group in for a family birthday party, and had a great time. There was something to do in Stratford for all age groups, and the hotel was excellent.
reviews.title: A Really Good Experience
Ideal location, great room and breakfast!
reviews.text: The weekend wasn't even spoiled by a fire alarm at the hotel which resulted in guests being evacuated to the car park - some in night clothes.

reviews.title: Typical Holiday Inn
reviews.text: The rooms were spotless and well furnished, the gym and spa facilities were perfect, the staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was brilliant - superb breakfasts and a fantastic carvery in the evening. One young chef in particular was outstanding, taking a great pride in his work, and ensuring that all guests were being looked after.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good value

reviews.text: A great weekend.
reviews.title: Location is everything

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days, just after Christmas 2006 and only booked it the week before, so I guess with 200+ rooms it was the only one readily available at such short notice. Having said that, the hotel suited us in all that we planned to do. We saw a play at the Royal Shakespeare Theatre, visited several Shakespearean properties in the town and had great meals along Sheep Street - all within easy walking distance of the hotel. So location was a big plus for the hotel - just bring along your shades to shield off the garish corridor carpets and don't wear 70's checked brown for breakfast or you might merge with the restaurant carpets. Breakfast wasn't great either - functional in the manner of a school or military canteen, with coffee straight out of a vending machine. Nevertheless we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this beautiful and historic part of England.
reviews.title: Great location, shame about ...

reviews.text: Oh dear. Oh dear.
reviews.title: Truly depressing place

reviews.text: Chose the hotel because near city centre and wanted to go from the theatre direct to bed. In that sense it was an adequate choice. But the place is tired and depressingly decorated. Everything is low-grade and the smell of the fatty cheap food was really off-putting. The walls are made of cardboard and the static-filled carpets are memorable. Breakfast was horrible and the two people on reception were obviously sharing one brain-cell.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Stay there if you have to, but you will need a drink!
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on business.
reviews.title: excellent accommodation and pleasant staff
Rooms nice - pretty much everything else not good
reviews.text: I stayed here on business for 2 nights. The room I had in itself was quite nice for a business type hotel. It was clean and fresh, and quite big. Its convenient for the town centre. The staff were very helpful and eager to please.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: OK, thats all the good stuff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were just not enough staff at check-out time. It took me 15 minutes wait just to see some about a minor query. For a hotel of this size, to only have 2 staff on at peak checkout time was frankly ridiculous.
reviews.title: Great Location & Refurbished Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was terrible - the mattress was shot to bits and had no support.
reviews.title: Good link in a Chain

reviews.text: The outside of the hotel looks very dated and is in need of much refreshing. The reception is ok but when you get into the corridors leading to the rooms the decor is very shabby - more in keeping with a bad B&B in Blackpool.
reviews.title: Pretty mediocre

likes.disliked: — The poor value for money and the surly night front desk.

description: Situated on the River Avon and set in beautiful landscaped gardens, the 4 star Holiday Inn Stratford-upon-Avon is the perfect location for discovering the delights of Shakespeare's birthplace, while other local attractions and historical sites are within walking distance.The hotel is within easy reach of J15 off the M40 and 20 miles from Birmingham Airport and the NEC and only a short drive from the amazing Warwick Castle.All 259 refurbished bedrooms have air-conditioning, wireless internet access and tea and coffee making facilities. Renowned as an excellent meeting and conference venue and with the impressively modernised Ballroom with adjoining exhibition areas Holiday Inn Stratford-upon-Avon can host events for up to 550 delegates. To dine in style, the Terrace Lounge and Bar and the Riverside Restaurant offer excellent food to suit all tastes. Or to really unwind and recuperate, the leisure club is available for all guests to use with a wide range of first class facilities including a fully equipped gymnasium, indoor heated swimming pool, sauna and whirlpool. Discover Stratford-upon-Avon and visit the many nearby places of interest including the National Exhibition Centre, The Royal Shakespeare Theatre, Warwickshire and the Heritage Motor Centre. The Hotel, in compliance with UK smoking regulations is completley non smoking.
